item.title: User Session Management in Linux
item.description: program –> is executed by the operating system with the help of kernel OS (kernel) (RAM + CPU) –> program converts into process and loads on the RAM RAM <– will the take all the information from the CPU If the entire RAM or CPU is asked by the program, by default the operating system assigns the resources but this can be not good practice for the other (crtical) resources.
